p: These changes in intracellular and extracellular environments demonstrate potential physiologic distress (Bekkevold et al., 2013 ▶). Further, changes in the intracellular environment can affect the activity of other hormones (Hohenegger et al., 1986). One of these hormones is aldosterone, which causes a decrease in the sodium output from the proximal tubules, preserving plasma sodium and driving the maintenance of body fluid by cellular dehydration (Rowland et al., 2004 ▶). The results of this study demonstrated that the sodium output was less in PO groups compared to the control group.
